intro: Synoplectris picta, commonly known as the painted grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, spikelet-based flowers that are often green or pale in color. Synoplectris picta thrives in dry, open habitats such as meadows and slopes. Its distinctive appearance and ecological role make it an important species in its native range.
